intro: Androsace tibetica var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan Androsace, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and covered in a fine layer of white or silver hairs. This species is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
